alert.note: Alert for Culebra; Mayaguez and Vicinity; Northwest (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 18 at 7:22AM ADT until August 18 at 6:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Heat index values of 108 to 111 degrees Fahrenheit. * WHERE...Aguadilla, Camuy, Hatillo, Isabela, Quebradillas, Aguada, Anasco, Hormigueros, Mayaguez, Moca, Rincon, San German, and Culebra. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 5 PM AST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Heat exhaustion is possible with prolonged exposure. Heat stroke possible. * ADDITIONAL INFO...The Excessive Heat Warning was cancelled and replaced by a Heat Advisory, as heat indices across western Puerto Rico and Culebra should remain under 112 degrees Fahrenheit.
info.instruction: A Heat Advisory means that a period of hot temperatures is expected. The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity will combine to create a situation in which heat illnesses are possible. Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Take extra precautions, if you work or spend time outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible and drink plenty of water.
